snippet: Whether you can obtain a job, credit or insurance can be based on your digital doppelgänger - and you may never know why you've been turned down.
abstract: Whether you can obtain a job, credit or insurance can be based on your digital doppelgänger - and you may never know why you've been turned down.
lead_paragraph: Ads that pop up on your screen might seem useful, or at worst, a nuisance. But they are much more than that. The bits and bytes about your life can easily be used against you, warns Lori Andrews, author of "I Know Who You Are and I Saw What You Did: Social Networks and the Death of Privacy," in an Opinion piece in The New York Times.Read more »
